title: Real-time highway traffic updates soon on radio, says transport minister Gadkari | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
Real-time highway traffic updates soon on radio, says transport minister Gadkari india Updated: Feb 09, 2017 18:42 IST New Delhi Transport minister Nitin Gadkari speaks in the Lok Sabha in New Delhi on Thursday.(PTI/ TV grab) 
To provide real-time traffic updates to commuters, government will start highway radio services on various national highways spread across 13 states. 
Road transport and highways minister Nitin Gadkari said in the Lok Sabha on Thursday that highway radio services has been started on the Delhi-Jaipur highway. 
Phase I of the pilot project on Highway Advisory Services to provide real-time traffic updates was implemented on Delhi-Jaipur NH-8 and the pilot project was implemented under the World Bank Technical Assistance programme, he added. 
During Question Hour, Gadkari said highway radio services would be started on various national highways spread across 13 states. Read more
